instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> weirdness
threads.message:
Board has very weird behavior.
It did not had green light initially. Changed the IO board. That fixed it.
After some days of sitting I could not get green light again so got out the board then I could have green light.
So I checked the flex cables and came to the conclusion that there is something with the battery led flex. When it is not connected everything is okay.
Tried with another one. It works but if I try the old one and then change it to the new one it will not get green light always.
So I was thinking could it be something else on the board?
Checked connector with microscope. Visually looks fine.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> weirdness
threads.message: The BIL cable themselves can be problematic, especially when liquid-damaged. Replace BIL assembly if it's causing issues. Pretty common.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> weirdness
threads.message: I came to the same conclusion. Replaced it, now works perfectly. Thx. ;)
